newsitem.title: USA: Systems & Computer sees Q4 EPS $0.20-$0.21.
newsitem.headline: Systems & Computer sees Q4 EPS $0.20-$0.21.

text.p: Systems & Computer Technology Corp said on Tuesday that it expected its fully diluted fourth quarter fiscal 1996 earnings to be between $0.20 and $0.21 per share, due to strength in its higher education businesses and in its utility license revenues.
The company said it expected its revenues would be about $58 million in the fourth quarter and $215 million in the fiscal year. Both figures were company records, it said.
Systems also said its cash and cash equivalents, net of short-term debt, would be about $10 million, reflecting a $19 million increase from the balance at June 30.
But the company said its local government and manufacturing divisions did not close anticipated levels of new business in the quarter, as they tried to become a cohesive unit.
Systems & Computer, which was not immediately available to comment further, said its education and utility business had a strong quarter.

"Once again, our education division exhibited its leadership position in the higher education market with record revenue and profits for the fourth quarter and the fiscal year," said Michael Emmi, Systems & Computer chairman and chief executive officer.
Emmi also its utility busines enjoyed its second-highest licence fee quarter and its best six months of license fee revenue ever.
